alert.note: Alert for Southern Fairfield; Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 12 at 4:44PM EST until January 13 at 3:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 3 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline during high tide tonight, and 2 to 2 1/2 ft for the Saturday morning high tide. * WHERE...Southern Fairfield and Southern New Haven Counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 3 PM EST Saturday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline Saturday morning, with 2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront would likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 to 4 ft during the Saturday morning high tide along coastal CT. This will result in beach erosion, as well as wave splashover onto shoreline roads and properties. * RIVERINE IMPACTS...Freshwater runoff coinciding with the Saturday morning high tide will exacerbate street and property flooding issues along tidal reaches of rivers in southwestern CT and coastal Westchester. Surge up the Hudson River with the Saturday morning high tide will likely cause minor flooding for low-lying river-front communities in Westchester, Rockland, Orange and Putnam counties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The timing of a wind shift from southeasterly to southwesterly gales in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning will be key to the water level forecast. Peak surge of 3 to 4 ft will be likely between times of high tide this evening and Saturday morning, with surge falling behind the wind shift. An earlier and/or stronger windshift would keep flood levels below moderate. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. STAMFORD HARBOR AT STAMFORD CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.3 FT, MODERATE 10.9 FT, MAJOR 12.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 3.1 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/12 AM 9.5/10.0 1.7/ 2.2 1.7/ 2.2 2-4 MINOR 13/12 PM 11.0/11.5 3.2/ 3.7 2.6/ 3.1 2-3 MODERATE 14/01 AM 7.2/ 7.7 -0.7/-0.2 -0.9/-0.4 3-4 NONE 14/01 PM 8.0/ 8.5 0.2/ 0.7 -0.2/ 0.2 2-4 NONE BRIDGEPORT HARBOR AT BRIDGEPORT CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.7 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 11.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.4 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/12 AM 8.6/ 9.1 1.3/ 1.8 1.8/ 2.2 1-2 MINOR 13/01 PM 10.2/10.7 2.8/ 3.4 2.7/ 3.2 2-3 MODERATE 14/01 AM 6.1/ 6.6 -1.3/-0.8 -0.9/-0.4 1 NONE 14/01 PM 7.3/ 7.8 0.0/ 0.5 -0.2/ 0.2 2 NONE NEW HAVEN HARBOR AT NEW HAVEN CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.7 FT, MODERATE 9.3 FT, MAJOR 10.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/12 AM 8.0/ 8.5 1.3/ 1.8 1.7/ 2.2 1-3 NONE 13/12 PM 9.5/10.0 2.7/ 3.2 2.2/ 2.7 2-3 MODERATE 14/01 AM 5.7/ 6.2 -1.1/-0.6 -0.8/-0.2 3-4 NONE 14/01 PM 6.8/ 7.3 0.1/ 0.6 -0.2/ 0.2 2 NONE &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
